dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/369510454 at Wed Dec  4 16:46:52 UTC 2019

panels.title: 🗞️ Headline Metrics - 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘬𝘦𝘺 𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘪𝘤𝘦 𝘮𝘦𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘴 𝘳𝘰𝘸 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘥𝘦𝘵𝘢𝘪𝘭𝘴

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.
panels.title: Latency: Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions within a minute period. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better
panels.title: Error Ratios

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg(
  clamp_min(
    gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"} -
    2 * gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"},
    0
  )
)

avg(
  clamp_min(
    gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage=""} -
    2 * gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage=""},
    0
  )
)

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: Percentage time the latency SLI for this service is within SLO
panels.title: 7d Latency SLA

targets.expr:
sort(
  max(
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s1", alertstate="firing"} * 4
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s2", alertstate="firing"} * 3
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s3", alertstate="firing"} * 2
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="gitaly", alertstate="firing"}
  ) by (alertname, severity)
)

panels.description: Percentage time the error ratio SLI for this service is within SLO
panels.title: 7d Error Rate SLA

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within an acceptable threshold duration. Actual threshold vary per service or endpoint. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max((
  sum(rate(grpc_server_handling_seconds_bucket{environment="$environment", stage="$stage",type="gitaly", tier="stor", grpc_type="unary", le="0.5", grpc_method!~"GarbageCollect|Fsck|RepackFull|RepackIncremental|CommitLanguages|CreateRepositoryFromURL|UserRebase|UserSquash|CreateFork|UserUpdateBranch|FindRemoteRepository|UserCherryPick|FetchRemote|UserRevert|FindRemoteRootRef"}[1m])) by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn)
  +
  sum(rate(grpc_server_handling_seconds_bucket{environment="$environment", stage="$stage",type="gitaly", tier="stor", grpc_type="unary", le="1", grpc_method!~"GarbageCollect|Fsck|RepackFull|RepackIncremental|CommitLanguages|CreateRepositoryFromURL|UserRebase|UserSquash|CreateFork|UserUpdateBranch|FindRemoteRepository|UserCherryPick|FetchRemote|UserRevert|FindRemoteRootRef"}[1m])) by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn)
)
/
2 / (sum(rate(grpc_server_handling_seconds_count{environment="$environment", stage="$stage",type="gitaly", tier="stor", grpc_type="unary", grpc_method!~"GarbageCollect|Fsck|RepackFull|RepackIncremental|CommitLanguages|CreateRepositoryFromURL|UserRebase|UserSquash|CreateFork|UserUpdateBranch|FindRemoteRepository|UserCherryPick|FetchRemote|UserRevert|FindRemoteRootRef"}[1m])) by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn))
,1),0)

panels.title: Apdex score per Gitaly Node

panels.description: Number of Git commands running concurrently per node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Inflight Git Commands per Server

panels.description: Average Peak read throughput as a ratio of specified max (over 30s) per Node, on the Gitaly disk (sdb). Lower is better.
panels.title: Average Peak Read Throughput per Node

panels.description: Average Peak write throughput as a ratio of specified max (over 30s) per Node, on the Gitaly disk (sdb). Lower is better.
panels.title: Average Peak Write Throughput per Node

panels.description: Golang uses a global lock on process spawning. In order to control contention on this lock Gitaly uses a safety valve. If a request is unable to obtain the lock within a period, a timeout occurs. These timeouts are serious and should be addressed. Non-zero is bad.
panels.title: Gitaly Spawn Timeouts per Node

panels.description: Percentage of requests that acquire a Gitaly rate-limit lock within 1 minute, by host and method
panels.title: Request % acquiring rate-limit lock within 1m, by host + method

panels.description: Availability measures the ratio of component processes in the service that are currently healthy and able to handle requests. The closer to 100% the better.
panels.title: Component Availability

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg(
  clamp_min(
    gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"} -
    2 * gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"},
    0
  )
)

avg(
  clamp_min(
    gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage=""} -
    2 * gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage=""},
    0
  )
)

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better
panels.title: Node Maximum Single Core Utilization

panels.description: Network utilization for nodes for this service
panels.title: Node Network Utilization

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.
panels.title: Memory Utilization

panels.description: Disk Read IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read IOPs

panels.description: Disk Write IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write IOPs

panels.description: Disk Read throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Throughput

panels.description: Disk Write throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Throughput

panels.description: Total time spent in read operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Total Time

panels.description: Total time spent in write operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Total Time

panels.span:
Cgroup memory saturation per node.

Some services, notably Gitaly, are configured to run within a cgroup with a memory limit lower than the
memory limit for the node. This ensures that a traffic spike to Gitaly does not affect other services on the node.

If this resource is becoming saturated, this may indicate traffic spikes to Gitaly, abuse or possibly resource leaks in
the application. Gitaly or other git processes may be killed by the OOM killer when this resource is saturated.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    (
  container_memory_usage_bytes{id="/system.slice/gitlab-runsvdir.service", environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"} -
  container_memory_cache{id="/system.slice/gitlab-runsvdir.service", environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"} -
  container_memory_swap{id="/system.slice/gitlab-runsvdir.service", environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"}
)
/
container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{id="/system.slice/gitlab-runsvdir.service", environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"}

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cgroup_memory component saturation: Cgroup Memory Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

This resource measures all CPU across a fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal or
vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    avg(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization per Device per Node

panels.span:
Disk sustained read IOPS saturation per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    rate(node_disk_reads_completed_total{type="gitaly", device="sdb", environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"}[$__interval]) / (60000)
or
rate(node_disk_reads_completed_total{type="nfs", device="sdb", environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"}[$__interval]) / (15000)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_read_iops component saturation: Disk Sustained Read IOPS Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Disk sustained read throughput saturation per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    rate(node_disk_read_bytes_total{type="gitaly", device="sdb", environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"}[$__interval]) / (1258291200)
or
rate(node_disk_read_bytes_total{type="nfs", device="sdb", environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"}[$__interval]) / (838860800)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_read_throughput component saturation: Disk Sustained Read Throughput Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Gitaly runs on Google Cloud's Persistent Disk product. This has a published sustained
maximum write IOPS value. This value can be exceeded for brief periods.

If a single node is consistently reaching saturation, it may indicate a noisy-neighbour repository,
possible abuse or it may indicate that the node needs rebalancing.

More information can be found at
https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/disks/performance.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    rate(node_disk_writes_completed_total{type="gitaly", device="sdb", environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"}[$__interval]) / (30000)
or
rate(node_disk_writes_completed_total{type="nfs", device="sdb", environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"}[$__interval]) / (15000)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_write_iops component saturation: Disk Sustained Write IOPS Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Gitaly runs on Google Cloud's Persistent Disk product. This has a published sustained
maximum write throughput value. This value can be exceeded for brief periods.

If a single node is consistently reaching saturation, it may indicate a noisy-neighbour repository,
possible abuse or it may indicate that the node needs rebalancing.

More information can be found at
https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/disks/performance.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    rate(node_disk_written_bytes_total{type="gitaly", device="sdb", environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"}[$__interval]) / (419430400)
or
rate(node_disk_written_bytes_total{type="nfs", device="sdb", environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"}[$__interval]) / (419430400)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_write_throughput component saturation: Disk Sustained Write Throughput Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.span:
Open file descriptor saturation per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor saturation per instance

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    avg(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", type="gitaly", stage="$stage"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Go's memory allocation strategy can make it look like a Go process is saturating memory when measured using RSS, when in fact
the process is not at risk of memory saturation. For this reason, we measure Go processes using the `go_memstat_alloc_bytes`
metric instead of RSS.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: go_memory component saturation: Go Memory Saturation per Node

panels.title: Resources Forecasted to be at Risk of Saturation in 14d

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="gitaly",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"$stage|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation - Rolling 1w average trend
